item.title: Election 2024: Trump announces Cabinet picks to mixed reactions
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: Follow updates on Trump’s transition plans after the 2024 election: Cabinet selections like Matt Gaetz, CPAC at Mar-a-Lago and key developments.
item.content:encoded:
Coverage on this live blog has ended.

What to watch in Washington today

  • President-elect Donald Trump continues to <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/specials/trumps-white-house-cabinet-appointments-tracker-selections/" target="_blank">build out his Cabinet</a> ahead of his inauguration, announcing today that <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/health/health-news/trump-picks-rfk-jr-anti-vaccine-activist-health-human-services-secreta-rcna180182" target="_blank">Robert F. Kennedy Jr.</a>, an anti-vaccine activist, is his pick to lead the Department of Health and Human Services. The pick has been met with <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/congress/mixed-reactions-senators-trump-pick-rfk-jr-hhs-secretary-rcna180251" target="_blank">mixed reactions</a> from senators.
  • Trump also this evening announced he'd <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-nominates-todd-blanche-deputy-attorney-general-rcna180260" target="_blank">tapped Todd Blanche</a> to be deputy attorney general, former Rep. Doug Collins to be <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/donald-trump-picks-doug-collins-veterans-affairs-secretary-rcna180263" target="_blank">secretary of veterans affairs</a> and North Dakota Gov. Doug Burgum to be <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-announces-north-dakota-gov-doug-burgum-pick-interior-secretary-rcna180277" target="_blank">secretary of the interior</a>.
  • A gathering of the Conservative Political Action Conference kicked off at Trump's Mar-a-Lago residence in Florida today. Trump himself took the stage and announced the selection of Burgum.
  • Trump announced three picks yesterday, including <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/justice-department/trump-announces-matt-gaetz-pick-attorney-general-rcna180042" target="_blank">Matt Gaetz</a> to be attorney general. The selection of Gaetz, R-Fla., who <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/live-blog/trump-2024-election-transition-plans-live-updates-rcna179531/rcrd64513?canonicalCard=true" target="_blank">offered his resignation</a> from the House after the announcement, <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-baffles-republican-senators-picking-matt-gaetz-attorney-general-rcna180048" target="_blank">stunned many Senate Republicans</a>, who warned his road to confirmation is not likely to be smooth.

Follow our live blog for full coverage

media:content.media:text: Image: donald trump politics political politician rally
media:content.media:description: Donald Trump at a rally in Pittsburgh on Nov. 4.

item.title: Oz and Fetterman debate highlights: PA candidates clash on abortion, fracking
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: Live updates on the Pennsylvania Senate race debate as John Fetterman, the Democratic lieutenant governor faces Republican Mehmet Oz, a celebrity TV doctor.
item.content:encoded:
What to know about the Pa. Senate debate

  • The debate between Democratic Lt. Gov. John Fetterman and Republican celebrity doctor Mehmet Oz lasted roughly an hour.
  • The candidates sparred over <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/live-blog/oz-fetterman-pa-senate-debate-live-updates-rcna53008#rcrd6106" target="_blank">abortion</a>, <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/live-blog/oz-fetterman-pa-senate-debate-live-updates-rcna53008#rcrd6113" target="_blank">fracking</a> and <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/live-blog/oz-fetterman-pa-senate-debate-live-updates-rcna53008#rcrd6120" target="_blank">immigration</a>. Here are the key <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/one-hour-fetterman-oz-key-takeaways-only-debate-rcna54032" target="_blank">takeaways</a>.
  • Both campaigns agreed to a closed captioning accommodation to allow Fetterman, who is recovering from a stroke, to read questions and answers spoken and transcribed instantly.
  • The close contest could decide control of the Senate.

Follow our live blog for full coverage

media:content.media:text: Democratic Senate candidate John Fetterman; Republican Senate candidate Mehmet Oz.
media:content.media:description: Democratic Senate candidate John Fetterman; Republican Senate candidate Mehmet Oz.

media:content.media:text: Democratic Senate candidate John Fetterman; Republican Senate candidate Mehmet Oz.
media:content.media:description: Democratic Senate candidate John Fetterman; Republican Senate candidate Mehmet Oz.

item.title: Midterm elections updates: Democrats pick up key Pennsylvania Senate seat
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: Midterm elections 2022 are underway. Get live updates, the latest coverage and find out what times polls close on Election Day as voters determine whether the GOP or Democrats will win the House, the Senate and governor races in each state.
item.content:encoded:
This liveblog coverage has ended. Click here for the latest news on the 2022 midterm election results.


Latest midterm election news

  • Here’s a guide to <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/nbc-news-decision-desk-calls-races-midterm-election-night-2022-rcna55828" target="_blank">how NBC News calls races on election night</a>.
  • John Fetterman, the state lieutenant governor, has won Pennsylvania’s <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/pennsylvania-senate-midterm-2022-john-fetterman-wins-election-rcna54935" target="_blank">high-voltage race</a> for an open Senate seat, NBC News projects, defeating celebrity TV doctor Mehmet Oz.
  • J.D. Vance, the “Hillbilly Elegy” author who was a searing Donald Trump critic before he converted into one of his most loyal allies, has defeated Democratic Rep. Tim Ryan <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/ohio-senate-midterm-2022-jd-vance-wins-rcna55175" target="_blank">in Ohio’s Senate race</a>, <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/ohio-senate-midterm-2022-jd-vance-wins-rcna55175" target="_blank">NBC News projects</a>.
  • Democrats won key governor's races in <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/michigan-governor-election-2022-gretchen-whitmer-wins-race-rcna55171" target="_blank">Michigan</a>, <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/josh-shapiro-declared-winner-2022-pennsylvania-governor-midterm-electi-rcna55169" target="_blank">Pennsylvania</a> and <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/wisconsin-governor-election-2022-tony-evers-wins-race-rcna55089" target="_blank">Wisconsin</a>, according to NBC News projections. In Maryland, voters elected the state’s first Black governor, while <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/nbc-out/out-politics-and-policy/massachusetts-maura-healey-rcna55236" target="_blank">Massachusetts voters</a> elected the first lesbian to lead a state.
  • Citing Republican losses in <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-elections/new-hampshire-results?icid=election_nav" target="_blank">New Hampshire</a> and <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-elections/colorado-results?icid=election_nav" target="_blank">Colorado</a>, Republican Sen. Lindsey Graham of South Carolina said the midterm results were “<a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/control-congress-midterm-voters-economy-abortion-rcna56121" target="_blank">definitely not a Republican wave</a>, that is for darn sure.”
  • Americans named inflation and abortion as the most important issues driving their votes Tuesday, edging out crime despite Republicans’ hammering the issue, according to the <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-elections/exit-polls?icid=election_nav" target="_blank">NBC News Exit Poll</a>.

Follow our live blog for full coverage

media:content.media:text: Photo illustration of stars, scribbled in ballots, a hand putting a ballot into a box, the Capitol in Washington, and an "I Voted" sticker.

item.title: Midterm elections see key runoff, razor-thin races as Senate and House control hangs in the balance
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: Close Senate races in Arizona and Nevada remain too early to call after Election Day, while Georgia heads to a runoff and Alaska moves to ranked choice voting.
item.content:encoded:
Latest midterm election news

  • Which party will control the House and the Senate remains unclear as votes are still being counted and key races remain too early to call, including the <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-elections/arizona-senate-results" target="_blank">Arizona</a> and <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-elections/nevada-senate-results?icid=election_usmap" target="_blank">Nevada</a> Senate races.
  • The <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/georgia-senate-midterm-2022-race-walker-warnock-heads-runoff-rcna54928" target="_blank">Georgia Senate race</a> is headed to a Dec. 6 runoff after neither Democratic Sen. Raphael Warnock nor Republican challenger Herschel Walker topped the 50% required under state law to win on the first ballot.
  • Democrats largely <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/control-congress-midterm-voters-economy-abortion-rcna56121" target="_blank">exceeded expectations</a> but they unexpectedly fell short in other contests. One Democratic incumbent who won't be returning to Congress is <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/live-blog/midterm-elections-live-updates-rcna56065#rcrd7314" target="_blank">Rep. Sean Patrick Maloney of New York</a>, the chairman of House Democrats’ campaign arm.
  • Republicans <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/live-blog/midterm-elections-live-updates-rcna56065#rcrd7323" target="_blank">Ron Johnson</a> and J.D. Vance notched wins in the <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-elections/wisconsin-senate-results?icid=election_usmap" target="_blank">Wisconsin</a> and <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-elections/ohio-senate-results?icid=election_usmap" target="_blank">Ohio</a> Senate races, respectively, and the GOP swept key races in <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/live-blog/elections-2022-live-updates-rcna55757#rcrd7065" target="_blank">Florida</a>. <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/ohio-senate-midterm-2022-jd-vance-wins-rcna55175" target="_blank">Vance</a>, the “Hillbilly Elegy” author who was a searing Donald Trump critic before he converted to a loyal ally, defeated Democrat Tim Ryan.
  • In his first public remarks since Tuesday’s midterms, President Joe Biden said Democrats had a <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/live-blog/midterm-elections-live-updates-rcna56065#rcrd7396" target="_blank">“strong night”</a> after a predicted GOP red wave “didn’t happen.” He later spoke with House Minority Kevin McCarthy, R-Calif., who earlier in the day declared his candidacy for speaker if Republicans control the House.

Follow our live blog for full coverage

media:content.media:text: Photo illustration of ballot bubbles, a hand holding a ballot, a ballot dropbox, and "I Voted" sticker.

item.title: Georgia runoff 2022 highlights: Warnock defeats Walker, NBC News projects
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: Sen. Raphael Warnock defeated Herschel Walker Tuesday night.
item.content:encoded:
What to know about Tuesday's runoff

  • Democratic Sen. Raphael Warnock defeated football star Herschel Walker in a runoff, NBC News projected, after neither candidate cleared the threshold for victory in the November midterm elections.
  • More than <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/georgia-senate-runoff-smashes-early-voting-records-attracts-new-voters-rcna59981" target="_blank">1.85 million votes </a>were cast ahead of Tuesday's contest, breaking records. <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-elections/georgia-results#runoff-early-voting" target="_blank">Track early voting in the Georgia runoff here.</a> Full results <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-elections/georgia-senate-runoff-results" target="_blank">here</a>.
  • Warnock’s star rises as his runoff victory expands Democratic power in the Senate — and <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/takeways-georgia-runoff-warnock-wins-rcna60167" target="_blank">more key takeaways from Tuesday night</a>.

Follow our live blog for full coverage

media:content.media:text: Photo illustration of Georgia senate candidates Herschel Walker and Raphael Warnock, surrounded by "I Voted" stickers and filled in ballot bubbles.
Photo illustration of Georgia senate candidates Herschel Walker and Raphael Warnock, surrounded by "I Voted" stickers and filled in ballot bubbles.

item.title: Highlights: Brittney Griner released from Russian prison, Paul Whelan reacts
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: WNBA star Brittney Griner was released Thursday after the Biden administration negotiated her release from a Russian penal colony in exchange for an arms dealer Viktor Bout, according to a senior administration official.
item.content:encoded:
What to know about Brittney Griner

  • WNBA star Brittney Griner <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/wnba-star-brittney-griner-released-russian-custody-high-profile-prison-rcna60683" target="_blank">was freed </a>Thursday after the Biden administration negotiated her release from a Russian penal colony in exchange for Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout.
  • Biden, in a press conference, said Griner is "in good spirits" after being released and will be home within 24 hours. He also said the U.S. will "never give up" on securing the release of Paul Whelan, another American detained in Russia.
  • Griner's release marks one of the most high-profile prisoner swaps between Moscow and Washington since the Cold War.

Follow our live blog for full coverage

media:content.media:text: Brittney Griner arrives to a hearing at the Khimki Court, outside Moscow on July 27, 2022.
media:content.media:description: Brittney Griner arrives to a hearing at the Khimki Court, outside Moscow on July 27, 2022.

item.title: State of the Union highlights and analysis: Biden touts economic wins, spars with Republicans
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: Get live updates and video coverage of President Biden giving his State of the Union Address before Congress on Tuesday, February 7, 2022.
item.content:encoded:
Highlights from Biden's State of the Union address

  • President Joe Biden accused the GOP of threatening to take away Americans' Medicare and Social Security, <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/joe-biden/live-blog/biden-sotu-2023-live-updates-rcna68272#rcrd10711" target="_blank">prompting boos and Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, R-Ga., to shout</a>, "Liar!"
  • Biden <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/joe-biden/biden-says-economic-agenda-working-public-skeptical-rcna69623" target="_blank">stressed his economic record</a>, touting the pandemic recovery and pushing back on Republican attacks.
  • Acknowledging the grieving family of Tyre Nichols, <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/joe-biden/live-blog/biden-sotu-2023-live-updates-rcna68272#rcrd10700" target="_blank">Biden called for sweeping police reform</a>.
  • <a style="background-color:#ffffff" href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/white-house/sarah-huckabee-sanders-deliver-republican-state-union-response-rcna68830" target="_blank">Arkansas Gov. Sarah Huckabee Sanders</a> delivered the Republican rebuttal, attacking Biden and Democrats on <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/joe-biden/live-blog/biden-sotu-2023-live-updates-rcna68272#rcrd10627" target="_blank">culture war issues.</a>

Follow our live blog for full coverage

item.title: Primary election 2022 live updates: Pa. GOP Senate race in dead heat
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: Two of Trump's preferred candidates fared well: Rep. Ted Budd, R-N.C., won his state's Republican Senate primary, and state Sen.
item.content:encoded:
Everything to know about the primary

  • The Republican <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-primary-elections/pennsylvania-senate-results" target="_blank">Senate</a>primary in Pennsylvania, where former President Donald Trump's preferred candidate, Mehmet Oz, is locked in a dead heat with businessman Dave McCormick, remained too close to call into Wednesday, according to NBC News.
  • Voters in <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-primary-elections/calendar" target="_blank">five states</a>went to the polls Tuesday to decide the outcomes of some of the most <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2022-election/pennsylvania-previews-midterms-abortion-rights-fight-rcna29063" target="_blank">closely watched</a> primary <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/midterm-elections-2022" target="_blank">elections</a>of the 2022 midterms cycle, which tested Trump's influence and the GOP's rightward shift.

Two of Trump's preferred candidates fared well: Rep. Ted Budd, R-N.C., won his state's Republican Senate primary, and state Sen. Doug Mastriano, who rose to prominence by denying the results of the 2020 election, won the GOP primary in Pennsylvania's governor's race. But embattled first-term Rep. Madison Cawthorn, R-N.C., who wasn't formally endorsed by Trump but remains a close ally, conceded defeat.

Primary contests also took place in Idaho, Kentucky and Oregon.

Read the latest updates below:

Follow our live blog for full coverage

media:content.media:text: A man photographs himself depositing his ballot in an official ballot drop box while a long line of voters queue outside of Philadelphia City Hall at the satellite polling station in Philadelphia, on Oct. 27, 2020.
media:content.media:description: A man photographs himself depositing his ballot in an official ballot drop box at the satellite polling station in Philadelphia, on Oct. 27, 2020.

item.title: Election 2024: Trump taps Matt Gaetz and Tulsi Gabbard for top Cabinet posts; Republicans win the House
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: Follow updates on Trump’s transition plans after the 2024 election: Biden White House meeting, Cabinet selections and key developments.
item.content:encoded:
Coverage on this live blog has ended. For the latest news, click here.

What to watch in Washington today

  • President-elect <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump" target="_blank">Donald Trump</a> named multiple people he intends to nominate for <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/specials/trumps-white-house-cabinet-appointments-tracker-selections/" target="_blank">Cabinet positions</a> today, including Sen. <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/now/video/trump-officially-nominates-rubio-for-secretary-of-state-224364613850" target="_blank">Marco Rubio, R-Fla.,</a> to be secretary of state; controversial Rep. <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/justice-department/trump-announces-matt-gaetz-pick-attorney-general-rcna180042" target="_blank">Matt Gaetz</a>, R-Fla., to be attorney general; and former Democratic Rep. <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-names-tulsi-gabbard-director-national-intelligence-rcna180035" target="_blank">Tulsi Gabbard</a> to be the director of national intelligence. The Gaetz pick in particular <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-baffles-republican-senators-picking-matt-gaetz-attorney-general-rcna180048" target="_blank">stunned many Senate Republicans</a>, who warned his road to confirmation is not likely to be smooth.
  • Republicans will maintain control of the House, NBC News projected. The <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/republicans-win-house-majority-trump-party-senate-control-rcna179231" target="_blank">victory gives Republicans</a> all elements of power in Washington and will allow Trump to quickly fill his Cabinet and advance his agenda.
  • Trump and President <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/joe-biden/" target="_blank">Joe Biden</a> met at the White House this morning — Trump's first time in the building since he left office in 2021. Melania Trump rejected first lady Jill Biden's invitation to meet today.
  • Senate Republicans elected John Thune, R-S.D., as their <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/congress/senate-republicans-choose-new-leader-mitch-mcconnell-steps-rcna179670" target="_blank">next majority leader</a>. Thune <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/live-blog/trump-2024-election-transition-plans-live-updates-rcna179531/rcrd64494?canonicalCard=true" target="_blank">said after the vote</a> that he and Trump had spoken, and the president-elect met with all House Republicans this morning.

Follow our live blog for full coverage

media:content.media:text: Image: donald trump politics political politician
media:content.media:description: Former President Donald Trump during a campaign rally at The Expo at World Market Center Las Vegas, in Las Vegas, on Sept. 13, 2024.

item.title: Election 2024 live updates: Trump election interference case on halt; House majority still unclear
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: Latest news and updates following Donald Trump's historic win in the 2024 presidential race against Kamala Harris. Trump captured the victory Wednesday morning.
item.content:encoded:
Coverage on this live blog has ended.

What to know about the Trump transition plans

  • President-elect Donald Trump, fresh on the heels of <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/how-trump-won-harris-lost-2024-election-rcna178840" target="_blank">his victory</a> in the <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-elections/president-results" target="_blank">election</a>, is already working on <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-weighs-outsiders-elected-officials-builds-new-cabinet-rcna179154" target="_blank">staffing up</a> his next administration. Some high-profile options for Cabinet posts, such as Sen. Tom Cotton of Arkansas and Virginia Gov. Glenn Youngkin, have removed themselves from contention for now, but other hires are underway, like the selection of co-campaign chair <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-names-campaign-manager-susie-wiles-white-house-chief-staff-rcna179242" target="_blank">Susie Wiles to be the first female White House chief of staff</a>.
  • Meanwhile, the judge overseeing Trump’s criminal election interference trial has granted special counsel Jack Smith's request to pause the proceedings for a month to decide how to move forward, likely the beginning of an <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/doj-moving-wind-trump-criminal-cases-takes-office-rcna178930" target="_blank">end to the case.</a>
  • Vice President Kamala Harris <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/harris-concedes-presidential-race-trump-emotional-crowd-rcna176106" target="_blank">conceded the election</a> Wednesday, and her running mate, Gov. Tim Walz, <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/walz-vows-fight-trump-reach-supporters-return-minnesota-rcna179404" target="_blank">delivered remarks on the path forward</a> in Minnesota this afternoon, saying he'd protect his state from Trump’s “hateful agenda.” President Joe Biden <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/live-blog/presidential-election-trump-harris-2024-live-updates-rcna178894#rcrd64024">addressed the nation</a> yesterday and vowed a peaceful transfer of power.
  • Republicans secured <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-elections/senate-results" target="_blank">a Senate majority</a>, though two competitive Senate races are too close or too early to call. <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-elections/house-results" target="_blank">Control of the House</a> still hangs in the balance.

Follow our live blog for full coverage

media:content.media:text: Donald Trump.
media:content.media:description: Donald Trump on Nov. 6, 2024, in West Palm Beach, Fla.

item.title: Election 2024: Trump transition kicks off with chief of staff hire; Biden promises peaceful transfer of power
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: Latest news and updates following Donald Trump's historic win in the 2024 presidential race against Kamala Harris. Trump captured the victory Wednesday morning.
item.content:encoded:
Coverage on this live blog has ended. For the latest news, click here.

What to know about the 2024 election results

  • President-elect Donald Trump, fresh on the heels of <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/how-trump-won-harris-lost-2024-election-rcna178840" target="_blank">his victory</a> in the <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-elections/president-results" target="_blank">election</a>, is already working on <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-weighs-outsiders-elected-officials-builds-new-cabinet-rcna179154" target="_blank">staffing up</a> his next administration. His team announced a key hire today, saying campaign co-chair <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-names-campaign-manager-susie-wiles-white-house-chief-staff-rcna179242" target="_blank">Susie Wiles will be White House chief of staff</a>.
  • President Joe Biden <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/live-blog/presidential-election-trump-harris-2024-live-updates-rcna178894#rcrd64024">addressed the nation</a> from the Rose Garden in his first public remarks since the election and vowed a peaceful transfer of power on Jan. 20. He also encouraged supporters of Vice President Kamala Harris not to lose hope, telling them that while “setbacks are unavoidable, giving up is unforgivable.”
  • Harris <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/harris-concedes-presidential-race-trump-emotional-crowd-rcna176106" target="_blank">conceded the election</a> yesterday, imploring her supporters not to despair even as Democrats <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/shattered-democrats-grapple-kamala-harris-loss-rcna178967" target="_blank">grapple with her defeat</a>.
  • Republicans secured <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-elections/senate-results" target="_blank">a Senate majority</a>, though three competitive Senate races are too close or too early to call. <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-elections/house-results" target="_blank">Control of the House</a> still hangs in the balance.

Follow our live blog for full coverage

media:content.media:text: Image: Republican Presidential Nominee Donald Trump Holds Election Night Event In West Palm Beach
media:content.media:description: President-elect Donald Trump and Melania Trump during an election night event at the Palm Beach Convention Center on Nov. 6, 2024 in West Palm Beach, Fla.

item.title: Election 2024: Harris speaks to supporters in concession speech after Trump's victory
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: Updates and the latest news on the 2024 election as Donald Trump amasses Electoral College votes.
item.content:encoded:
What to know about the 2024 election results

  • Vice President Kamala Harris <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/harris-concedes-presidential-race-trump-emotional-crowd-rcna176106" target="_blank">addressed a crowd</a> of supporters hours after <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/trump-wins-election-president-harris-defeat-2024-race-rcna176107" target="_blank">Donald Trump was projected</a> the winner of the<a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/takeaways-trump-win-harris-election-2024-president-race-rcna177675" target="_blank"> 2024 presidential election.</a> She encouraged her supporters not to lose hope, saying that while she concedes the election, "I do not concede the fight that fueled this campaign."
  • Democrats are <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/shattered-democrats-grapple-kamala-harris-loss-rcna178967" target="_blank">grappling with the magnitude of Harris' loss</a>, with some saying the party has drifted from its onetime identity as the protectors of those left behind to representing <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/harris-celebrity-support-trump-sees-opening-attack-rcna172327" target="_blank">party elites and celebrities</a>.
  • The Trump transition team is <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/live-blog/presidential-election-trump-harris-2024-live-updates-rcna178894/rcrd64016?canonicalCard=true" target="_blank">actively working on staffing up</a>. Trump is expected to place a premium on Cabinet nominees without backgrounds in government service, and Donald Trump Jr. is seen as a final gatekeeper for job candidates.
  • Republicans will control the Senate, though Democrats were projected the winners of competitive Senate seats in Wisconsin and Michigan. <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/battle-control-house-democrats-republican-government-rcna178981" target="_blank">House control remains uncalled.</a>

Coverage on this live blog has ended. For the latest news on the election, click here.

Follow our live blog for full coverage

media:content.media:text: Republican Presidential Nominee Donald Trump Holds Election Night Event In West Palm Beach
media:content.media:description: Former President Donald Trump points to supporters with former first lady Melania Trump during an election night event at the Palm Beach County Convention Center in West Palm Beach, Fla., on Nov. 6, 2024.

item.title: Election 2024 live updates: Republicans win Senate and Trump takes Georgia in second battleground victory, NBC News projects
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: Live updates and the latest news on the 2024 election as voters hit the polls to decide who will be the next United States president, Kamala Harris or Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded:
What to know on Election Night

  • Former President Donald Trump spoke to supporters after he secured his third battleground victory of the evening by <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/trump-pennsylvania-win-election-swing-state-harris-rcna173820" target="_blank">clinching Pennsylvania</a>, bringing him closer to a White House win. Other swing states, including Michigan, Nevada and Wisconsin, are <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/election-2024-tracker-remaining-votes-swing-states-rcna178221" target="_blank">too close to call</a>.
  • Vice President <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/trump-harris-presidential-election-polls-votes-rcna177640" target="_blank">Kamala Harris</a> takes <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-elections/california-results" target="_blank">California</a>, New York and other traditionally Democratic states, but any path to victory narrows now that Trump has broken through Democrats' "blue wall."
  • Republicans will <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/house-senate-election-results-majority-democrats-republicans-congress-rcna176115" target="_blank">control the Senate</a> after they flipped some Democratic-held seats. The House is still up for grabs.
  • Separately, Democrat <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/angela-alsobrooks-wins-maryland-senate-race-defeating-republican-larry-rcna174770" target="_blank">Angela Alsobrooks</a> became the first Black woman elected to represent Maryland in the Senate, while Democrat <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/nbcblk/lisa-blunt-rochester-delaware-first-female-senator-election-win-rcna177903" target="_blank">Lisa Blunt Rochester</a> will be Delaware's first Black female senator.
  • Several <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/mark-robinson-loses-north-carolina-governor-josh-stein-rcna173891" target="_blank">governor's races</a> are also being decided, in addition to a number of <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-elections/florida-ballot-measures" target="_blank">crucial ballot measures</a> on issues like abortion and marijuana.

Coverage on this live blog has ended. For the latest news, click here.

Follow our live blog for full coverage

item.title: Harris and Trump hold final campaign rallies on eve of Election Day
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: Latest news coverage and updates on the 2024 presidential election between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris.
item.content:encoded:
What to know on the eve of Election Day

  • Former President <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/5-keys-trump-victory-rcna177749" target="_blank">Donald Trump</a> and Vice President <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/5-keys-kamala-harris-victory-rcna177750" target="_blank">Kamala Harris</a> hit the trail to deliver their closing messages in the final hours before Election Day.
  • Harris had several events scheduled in Pennsylvania, including a star-studded rally in Philadelphia in the evening. Trump, who secured a major <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/live-blog/election-2024-trump-harris-live-updates-rcna178430/rcrd62267?canonicalCard=true" target="_blank">endorsement tonight from Joe Rogan</a>, held rallies in North Carolina and Pennsylvania before his last campaign event in Grand Rapids, Michigan.
  • Their running mates had busy schedules, too: Minnesota Gov. <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/video/walz-biden-s-garbage-comments-were-about-rhetoric-from-trump-rally-223071301852" target="_blank">Tim Walz</a>, the Democratic vice presidential nominee, and Sen. <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/vance-joe-rogan-interview-trump-normal-gay-guy-vote-rcna178135" target="_blank">JD Vance</a> of Ohio, the Republican vice presidential nominee, both held events in the key battleground states of Michigan and Wisconsin.

Coverage on this live blog has ended. For the latest news, click here.

Follow our live blog for full coverage

media:content.media:text: Side by side of Donald Trump and Kamala Harris
media:content.media:description: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris.

item.title: Election 2024: Trump campaigns on the East Coast; Harris visits Michigan
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: Latest news and updates on the 2024 election. Follow the Trump-Vance and Harris-Walz campaigns in Michigan, Pennsylvania, North Carolina and Georgia ahead of the presidential election next week.
item.content:encoded:
Coverage on this live blog has ended. For the latest news, click here.

What's happening on the campaign trail today

  • Former President Donald Trump rallied in three East Coast battleground states today, speaking in Lititz, Pennsylvania; Kinston, <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/north-carolina-making-trump-campaign-nervous-rcna178523" target="_blank">North Carolina</a>; and Macon, Georgia.
  • Vice President Kamala Harris has made stops <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/nightly-news/video/trump-tries-to-gain-more-support-in-battleground-michigan-223334981958" target="_blank">throughout Michigan</a> today in Detroit, Livernois, Pontiac and East Lansing.
  • Their surrogates also hit the campaign trail today, with Sen. JD Vance, <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/rfk-jr-trump-white-house-remove-fluoride-water-rcna178543" target="_blank">Robert F. Kennedy Jr.</a> and Donald Trump Jr. holding events on behalf of the Trump campaign as former President Barack Obama, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz and first lady Jill Biden stump for the Harris campaign.

Follow our live blog for full coverage

media:content.media:text: Former President Donald Trump; Vice President Kamala Harris.
media:content.media:description: Former President Donald Trump; Vice President Kamala Harris.

item.title: Election 2024: Harris appears on ‘Saturday Night Live’; Trump speaks in North Carolina
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: Latest news and updates on the 2024 election. Follow the Trump-Vance and Harris-Walz campaigns in North Carolina, Virginia and Georgia ahead of the presidential election next week.
item.content:encoded:
Coverage on this live blog has ended.

What's happening on the campaign trail today

  • Vice President Kamala Harris is <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/kamala-harris-make-appearance-saturday-night-live-rcna178494" target="_blank">appearing on “Saturday Night Live”</a> now. Earlier, she held a campaign rally in Atlanta before traveling to North Carolina to address a crowd in Charlotte.
  • The Harris campaign continued to <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/kamala-harris-democratic-party-biggest-stars-closing-argument-rcna176875" target="_blank">rely on star power</a> today, with Michelle Obama <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/live-blog/harris-trump-michigan-wisconsin-rally-election-live-updates-rcna177531/rcrd61930?canonicalCard=true" target="_blank">speaking in Pennsylvania</a> alongside singer Alicia Keys and Harris’ running mate, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, appearing in Las Vegas this afternoon at a lunch alongside actor Eva Longoria.
  • Former President Donald Trump campaigned in North Carolina today, making stops in Gastonia and Greensboro. He also delivered remarks in Salem, Virginia, a state that <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/trump-campaigning-battleground-new-mexico-virginia-rcna177875" target="_blank">hasn't voted for a Republican presidential nominee</a> in decades.

Follow our live blog for full coverage

media:content.media:text: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump

item.title: Election 2024: Trump and Harris campaign in the Rust Belt
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: Latest news and updates on the 2024 election. Follow the Trump-Vance and Harris-Walz campaigns in Michigan and Wisconsin ahead of the presidential election next week.
item.content:encoded:
Coverage on this live blog has ended. For the latest news, click here.

What's happening on the campaign trail

  • Former President Donald Trump spoke in Warren, Michigan, and is slated to hold a rally in Milwaukee later on.
  • Vice President Kamala Harris also traveled <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/wisconsin-harris-outreach-trump-skeptical-republicans-rcna177361" target="_blank">through the Midwest</a> today, making stops across Wisconsin in Janesville, Little Chute and Milwaukee.
  • Their running mates, Sen. JD Vance and Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, also spent the day mostly in the same state as each other, making stops in Michigan. Vance later rallied in Selma, <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/now/video/inside-the-push-to-boost-democratic-turnout-in-a-key-north-carolina-county-223228485877" target="_blank">North Carolina</a>.
  • The Arizona attorney general's office <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/arizona-ags-office-probing-trumps-violent-comments-liz-cheney-rcna178228" target="_blank">said it was investigating</a> whether Trump's violent comments about former Rep. Liz Cheney at an event in Arizona broke the law.

Follow our live blog for full coverage

media:content.media:credit: Kevin Dietsch / Getty Images; Jabin Botsford for the Washington Post
media:content.media:text: Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump.
media:content.media:description: Vice President Kamala Harris; former President Donald Trump.

item.title: Election 2024: Trump and Harris campaign in Sun Belt states out West
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: Latest news and updates on the 2024 election. Follow the Trump-Vance and Harris-Walz campaigns in Nevada and Arizona ahead of the presidential election next week.
item.content:encoded:
Coverage on this live blog has ended. For the latest news, click here.

What's happening on the campaign trail today

  • Former President <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/trump-closing-argument-not-sticking-rcna176868" target="_blank">Donald Trump </a>rallied today in Albuquerque, New Mexico, before he headed to Henderson, Nevada. He's also set to participate in a hurricane relief benefit with Tucker Carlson in Glendale, Arizona, tonight.
  • Vice President <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/kamala-harris-calls-trump-fascist-argues-dangerous-unfit-office-rcna176713" target="_blank">Kamala Harris</a> held events out West today, participating in rally concerts in Phoenix and Las Vegas and speaking in Reno, Nevada. Ahead of the Phoenix event, she <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/kamala-harris-trump-devalues-women-making-choices-rcna178209" target="_blank">told NBC News</a> that <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/trump-protect-women-like-it-or-not-rcna178147" target="_blank">Trump's remarks yesterday</a> about protecting women whether they "like it or not" show how he "devalues" women.
  • Their running mates are also on the campaign trail. Minnesota Gov. <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/tim-walz-breaks-free-bubble-rcna175726" target="_blank">Tim Walz</a> held events in Pennsylvania. Sen. <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/jd-vance/vance-emerges-trumps-explainer-chief-rcna176573" target="_blank">JD Vance</a> stopped in North Carolina and sat down with podcaster Joe Rogan for an interview in which he suggested he and Trump can win the <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/vance-joe-rogan-interview-trump-normal-gay-guy-vote-rcna178135" target="_blank">“normal gay guy vote.”</a>

Follow our live blog for full coverage

media:content.media:text: Vice President Kamala Harris; Former President Donald Trump.
media:content.media:description: Vice President Kamala Harris; Former President Donald Trump.

item.title: Election 2024: Trump and Harris campaign in North Carolina, Wisconsin
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: The latest news and updates on the 2024 election. Follow the Trump-Vance and Harris-Walz campaigns ahead of the presidential election next week.
item.content:encoded:
Coverage on this live blog has ended. For the latest news, click here.

What's happening on the campaign trail today

  • Vice President <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/harris-will-ask-voters-turn-page-trump-era-site-jan-6-speech-rcna177669" target="_blank">Kamala Harris</a> is campaigning in three key states after she delivered what her campaign billed as her closing argument in <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/harris-will-ask-voters-turn-page-trump-era-site-jan-6-speech-rcna177669" target="_blank">a speech yesterday</a> in Washington, D.C. She spoke in Raleigh, North Carolina, and Harrisburg, Pennsylvania, and she's now in Madison, Wisconsin.
  • Former President <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/biden-republican-outrage-trump-rally-comedians-puerto-rico-rcna177926" target="_blank">Donald Trump</a> traveled to North Carolina as well for remarks in Rocky Mount in the early afternoon. He then spoke at a rally with former NFL quarterback Brett Favre in Green Bay, Wisconsin.
  • Harris' running mate, Minnesota Gov. <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/tim-walz-breaks-free-bubble-rcna175726" target="_blank">Tim Walz</a>, also campaigned today in North Carolina, speaking in Greensboro, Charlotte and Asheville.
  • Trump's running mate, Sen. <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/jd-vance/vance-emerges-trumps-explainer-chief-rcna176573" target="_blank">JD Vance</a> of Ohio, held a town hall in Bedford, Pennsylvania, with former Democratic Rep. Tulsi Gabbard of Hawaii, who has endorsed Trump.

Follow our live blog for full coverage

media:content.media:text: A split composite of Harris and Trump.
media:content.media:description: Vice President Kamala Harris; former President Donald Trump.

item.title: Election 2024: Harris vows to be pragmatist in 'closing argument'; Trump campaigns in Pennsylvania
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: Updates about the 2024 election. Follow updates about Kamala Harris and Donald Trump a week out from Election Day.
item.content:encoded:
What's happening on the campaign trail today

  • Vice President Kamala Harris delivered <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/harris-will-ask-voters-turn-page-trump-era-site-jan-6-speech-rcna177669" target="_blank">a closing argument speech</a> tonight at the Ellipse, the location of former President Donald Trump's Jan. 6, 2021, rally that preceded the <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/january-6-insurrection-us-capitol" target="_blank">Capitol riot</a>.
  • Trump spoke at Mar-a-Lago this morning before heading to Pennsylvania, where he held a rally <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-rallies-majority-latino-pennsylvania-city-supporters-crude-racis-rcna177854" target="_blank">in Allentown</a> after participating in <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/live-blog/election-2024-live-updates-harris-trump-rcna177528/rcrd61508?canonicalCard=true" target="_blank">a roundtable discussion</a> in Drexel Hill outside Philadelphia.
  • Trump's running mate, <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/jd-vance" target="_blank">Sen. JD Vance of Ohio</a>, held multiple events in Michigan. Harris' running mate, <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/tim-walz" target="_blank">Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz</a>, campaigned in Georgia.

Coverage on this live blog has ended. For the latest news, click here.

Follow our live blog for full coverage

media:content.media:text: Former President Donald Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris.
media:content.media:description: Former President Donald Trump; Vice President Kamala Harris.

item.title: Election 2024: Obama and Springsteen campaign for Harris; Trump rallies in Georgia
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: Follow Donald Trump in Atlanta and Barack Obama and Bruce Springsteen stumping for Kamala Harris in Philadelphia.
item.content:encoded:
Coverage on this live blog has ended.

What's happening on the campaign trail today

  • Former President Barack Obama and singer Bruce Springsteen appeared in Philadelphia at a "When We Vote We Win" concert as Vice President Kamala Harris campaigned in Michigan.
  • Former President Donald Trump spent the day in Georgia, where he attended the National Faith Summit near Atlanta before a rally at Georgia Tech.
  • Both vice presidential nominees, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz and Sen. JD Vance of Ohio, held events in the <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/wisconsin-harris-outreach-trump-skeptical-republicans-rcna177361" target="_blank">critical battleground state of Wisconsin</a>.

Follow our live blog for full coverage

media:content.media:text: Barack Obama Joins Kamala Harris As She Campaigns For President In Georgia
media:content.media:description: Vice President Kamala Harris, campaigns with former President Barack Obama on Oct. 24, 2024 in Clarkston, Ga.

item.title: Trump stumps in the Rust Belt; Harris campaigns with Michelle Obama
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: The latest news and updates on the 2024 election. Follow Donald Trump in Michigan and Pennsylvania and Kamala Harris after her Beyonce rally in Texas.
item.content:encoded:
Coverage on this live blog has ended. Follow the latest updates here.

What's happening on the campaign trail today

  • Vice President Kamala Harris <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/kamala-harris-democratic-party-biggest-stars-closing-argument-rcna176875" target="_blank">stumped alongside</a> former first lady Michelle Obama at a rally in Kalamazoo, Michigan, today. Obama, in her <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/obamas-hit-campaign-trail-first-joint-appearances-harris-rcna176034" target="_blank">first campaign trail appearance</a> this cycle, <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/michelle-obama-hits-trail-warning-trump-presidency-mean-womens-health-rcna177456" target="_blank">argued that there would be</a> "dire consequences for the future of women's health" if former President Donald Trump returns to office.
  • Trump swung through the Rust Belt today, holding an event in Novi, Michigan, before he took the stage in State College, Pennsylvania.
  • Minnesota Gov. <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/tim-walz" target="_blank">T</a><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/tim-walz" target="_blank">im Walz</a>, Harris' running mate, spoke at a <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/joe-biden/biden-apologizes-forced-native-american-boarding-school-policy-caused-rcna177242" target="_blank">Native Americans</a> for Harris-Walz get-out-the-vote event in Window Rock, Arizona, before giving remarks at a rally in Phoenix.
  • Trump's running mate, Sen. <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/jd-vance" target="_blank">JD Vance</a>, also hit the campaign trail today, making stops in Georgia and Pennsylvania.

Follow our live blog for full coverage

media:content.media:credit: AFP via Getty Images; Getty Images
media:content.media:text: politics political politicians kamala harris donald trump
media:content.media:description: Vice President Kamala Harris, former President Donald Trump.

item.title: Election 2024: Trump, Vance rally in Madison Square Garden; Harris campaigns in Philadelphia
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: Highlights from the 2024 election. Follow Donald Trump and JD Vance in New York City's Madison Square Garden and Kamala Harris in Philadelphia.
item.content:encoded:
Coverage on this live blog has ended.

What's happening on the campaign trail today

  • Former President Donald Trump and his running mate, Sen. JD Vance, rallied tonight at Madison Square Garden in New York City, though their remarks were at times overshadowed by <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/comedian-trump-rally-makes-racist-jokes-latinos-puerto-rico-rcna177514" target="_blank">disparaging jokes</a> about minority groups and other <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/trump-madison-square-garden-rally-allies-crude-racist-remarks-rcna177487" target="_blank">crude remarks from allies</a> during the pre-program lineup.
  • Vice President Kamala Harris <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/harris-heart-philadelphia-argues-trump-retribution-revenge-rcna177491" target="_blank">spent the day</a> in Philadelphia. <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/live-blog/harris-trump-election-live-updates-rcna176309/rcrd60990?canonicalCard=true" target="_blank">Her stops</a> in the western and northern parts of the city included speaking at a church service, visiting a barbershop and stopping at a Puerto Rican restaurant.
  • Harris surrogates also hit the campaign trail, with Sen. Bob Casey and singer John Legend also spending the day <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/critical-suburbs-philly-harris-volunteers-hunt-winnable-republicans-rcna176776" target="_blank">in Philadelphia</a> and her running mate, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, encouraging early voting during a stop today in Las Vegas.

Follow our live blog for full coverage

media:content.media:text: A split composite of Kamala Harris and Donald Trump.
media:content.media:description: Kamala Harris; Donald Trump.

item.title: Election 2024: Trump, Harris both campaign in Texas; Beyoncé appears at rally in Houston
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: The latest news and updates on the 2024 election. Follow Donald Trump and Kamala Harris in Texas and Barack Obama and JD Vance in North Carolina.
item.content:encoded:
Coverage on this live blog has ended.

What's happening on the campaign trail today

  • The phones of Republican presidential nominee <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump" target="_blank">Donald Trump</a> and his running mate, Sen. <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/jd-vance" target="_blank">JD Vance</a>, were targeted in a Chinese hacking campaign against U.S. telecommunication networks, two sources familiar with the matter <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/security/china-phone-target-hack-trump-vance-harris-rcna177383" target="_blank">told NBC News</a>. People affiliated with the campaign of Vice President <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/kamala-harris" target="_blank">Kamala Harris</a> were also targeted, another source said.
  • Both Trump and Harris have made appearances in Texas today. Trump spoke this afternoon in Austin, and Harris <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/kamala-harris-rallies-beyonce-willie-nelson-texas-rcna177407" target="_blank">held a campaign event in Houston</a>. The Harris event featured an <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/beyonce-expected-perform-harris-rally-houston-rcna177048" target="_blank">appearance by Beyoncé</a>.
  • Following Trump's remarks, he sat down for an interview on <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/trump-appear-joe-rogans-podcast-latest-outreach-young-male-voters-rcna176622" target="_blank">Joe Rogan's podcast.</a> A campaign spokesperson <a href="https://x.com/thestevencheung/status/1849954000109699180?s=46" target="_blank">said it lasted three hours</a>. That led him to be about three hours late for a rally in Michigan, where he attacked Harris as "horrible."
  • The presidential candidates' allies also participated in competing events in a different state. Former President Barack Obama and Republican vice presidential nominee JD Vance both held events this evening in <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/democrats-brace-crack-blue-wall-signs-north-carolina-slipping-rcna176046" target="_blank">North Carolina</a>.

Follow our live blog for full coverage

media:content.media:text: A split composite of Donald Trump and Kamala Harris.
media:content.media:description: Donald Trump; Kamala Harris.

item.title: Election 2024: Harris rallies in Georgia with Obama and Springsteen; Trump stumps out West
item.dc:creator: NBC News
item.description: Highlights from the 2024 election. Follow Donald Trump, Kamala Harris, Barack Obama and Bruce Springsteen in Arizona, Nevada and Georgia.
item.content:encoded:
Coverage on this live blog has ended. Follow the latest updates here.

What's happening on the campaign trail today

  • Vice President Kamala Harris continued to <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/nightly-news/video/harris-enlists-lizzo-usher-on-campaign-trail-as-early-voting-ramps-up-222192197626" target="_blank">use star power</a> on the campaign trail today, rallying at a get-out-the-vote event in Georgia alongside musician Bruce Springsteen, director Spike Lee, actor Samuel L. Jackson and former President Barack Obama.
  • Former President Donald Trump traveled out West this evening, holding rallies in the battleground states of <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2024-election/arizona-battleground-senate-house-races-rcna176110" target="_blank">Arizona</a> and Nevada. The Reno, Nevada, event specifically <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/asian-america/trump-headline-event-targeting-asian-american-voters-nevada-rcna176631" target="_blank">attempted to appeal to the state's Asian American population</a>.
  • Both of their running mates also hit the campaign trail today, with Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz making stops in North Carolina and Sen. JD Vance speaking at and participating in a town hall at separate events in Michigan.

Follow our live blog for full coverage
